question.body: Venous return is representative of which of the following?

response.feedback: Correct. Preload is the amount of blood in the heart at the end of diastole (end diastolic volume), which is determined by venous return.
Incorrect. Afterload is the pressure that the ventricle pumps into and is not generally associated with venous return.
Incorrect. Stroke volume is determined by venous return via the Frank-Starling relationship; however, stroke volume itself is not the best answer here.
Incorrect. End systolic volume is mainly determined by contractility and not necessarily venous return.

part.hint: Venous return refers to the volume of blood in the systemic veins that is flowing back to the heart.
